verses.text: On the first day of the seventh month you are to have a holy assembly. You shall do no work. It is a day of blowing the trumpets for you.
verses.comment: The Hebrew literally is 'a day of blowing', referring to trumpet blasts.

verses.text: You shall offer a burnt offering as a pleasing aroma to the Lord: one young bull, one ram, and seven male lambs a year old, without defect.
With their grain offering of fine flour mixed with oil: for the bull, three-tenths of an ephah; for the ram, two-tenths;
verses.comment: Ephah retained for accuracy (measure of grain, about 22 liters).

verses.text: and for each of the seven lambs, one-tenth of an ephah;
and one male goat for a sin offering, to make atonement for you;

besides the burnt offering of the new moon, and its grain offering, and the continual burnt offering with its grain and drink offerings, according to their rule as a pleasing aroma, an offering made by fire to the Lord.
verses.comment: "Continual burnt offering" refers to daily offerings, see Num. 28:3–8.

verses.text: On the tenth day of this seventh month you shall have a holy assembly. You shall humble yourselves. You shall do no work.
verses.comment: "Humble yourselves" is literally "afflict your souls" – refers to fasting.

verses.text: You shall present a burnt offering to the Lord, a pleasing aroma: one young bull, one ram, seven male lambs a year old; they must be without defect.
Their grain offering will be of fine flour mixed with oil: three-tenths of an ephah for the bull, two-tenths for the ram,
one-tenth for each of the seven lambs;
and one male goat for a sin offering, besides the sin offering of atonement, and the continual burnt offering with its grain and drink offerings.
verses.comment: Sin offering of atonement refers to the sacrifices of the Day of Atonement (Yom Kippur).

verses.text: On the fifteenth day of the seventh month you shall have a holy assembly. You shall do no work. You shall observe a festival to the Lord for seven days.
verses.comment: This is the Feast of Booths (Tabernacles).

verses.text: You shall offer a burnt offering, a food offering, an aroma pleasing to the Lord: thirteen young bulls, two rams, fourteen male lambs a year old; they must be without defect;
verses.comment: ‘Pleasing aroma’ is a Hebrew phrase indicating God’s acceptance.

verses.text: and their grain offering shall be of fine flour mixed with oil: three-tenths of an ephah for each of the thirteen bulls, two-tenths for each of the two rams,
and one-tenth for each of the fourteen lambs;
and one male goat for a sin offering, besides the continual burnt offering, its grain offering, and its drink offering.
verses.comment: Drink offering is wine poured out.

verses.text: On the second day: twelve young bulls, two rams, fourteen male lambs a year old, without defect;
verses.comment: Numbers of bulls decrease each day; rams and lambs are constant.

verses.text: and their grain offerings and drink offerings for the bulls, rams, and lambs, by number according to the statute;
verses.comment: "By number according to statute" — as prescribed.

verses.text: and one male goat for a sin offering, besides the continual burnt offering, its grain offering, and its drink offering.
On the third day: eleven bulls, two rams, fourteen male lambs a year old, without defect;
and their grain offerings and drink offerings for the bulls, rams, and the lambs, by number according to the statute;
and one male goat for a sin offering, besides the continual burnt offering, its grain offering, and its drink offering.
On the fourth day: ten bulls, two rams, fourteen male lambs a year old, without defect;
and their grain offerings and drink offerings for the bulls, rams, and the lambs, by number according to the statute;
and one male goat for a sin offering, besides the continual burnt offering, its grain offering, and its drink offering.
On the fifth day: nine bulls, two rams, fourteen male lambs a year old, without defect;
and their grain offerings and drink offerings for the bulls, rams, and the lambs, by number according to the statute;
and one male goat for a sin offering, besides the continual burnt offering, its grain offering, and its drink offering.
On the sixth day: eight bulls, two rams, fourteen male lambs a year old, without defect;
and their grain offerings and drink offerings for the bulls, rams, and the lambs, by number according to the statute;
and one male goat for a sin offering, besides the continual burnt offering, its grain offering, and its drink offering.
On the seventh day: seven bulls, two rams, fourteen male lambs a year old, without defect;
and their grain offerings and drink offerings for the bulls, rams, and the lambs, by number according to the statute;
and one male goat for a sin offering, besides the continual burnt offering, its grain offering, and its drink offering.
On the eighth day you shall have a solemn assembly. You shall do no work;
verses.comment: This is the closing gathering of the festival.

verses.text: You shall offer a burnt offering, a food offering, a pleasing aroma to the Lord: one bull, one ram, seven male lambs a year old, without defect;
and their grain offering and drink offerings for the bull, the ram, and the lambs, by number according to the statute;
and one male goat for a sin offering, besides the continual burnt offering, its grain offering, and its drink offering.

These you shall offer to the Lord at your appointed feasts, in addition to your vow offerings and your freewill offerings, for your burnt offerings, your grain offerings, your drink offerings, and your peace offerings.
verses.comment: Summarizes the required offerings in addition to voluntary offerings.

verses.text: So Moses told the people of Israel everything just as the Lord commanded Moses.
verses.comment: Concludes that Moses relayed the commands.
